data.title: Charles Tupper
data.text:
Born: 2-Jul-1821

Birthplace: Amherst, Nova Scotia, Canada

Died: 30-Oct-1915

Location of death: Bexleyheath, Kent, England

Cause of death: unspecified

Remains: Buried, St. John's Cemetery, Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada

Gender: Male

Religion: Baptist

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Head of State

Nationality: Canada

Executive summary: Prime Minister of Canada, 1896

Father: Charles Tupper (farmer)

Mother: Miriam Lowe Lockhart

Brother: Nathan

Wife: Frances Amelia Morse (b. 1826, m. 8-Oct-1846, d. 1912, three sons, three daughters)

Son: Orin Stewart

Son: Charles Hibbert

Son: William Johnston

Daughter: Emma

Daughter: Elizabeth Stewart ("Lilly")

Daughter: Sophy Almon

High School: Horton Academy, Wolfville

University: University of Edinburgh

Medical School: Royal College of Surgeons Edinburgh (1843)

Prime Minister of Canada 1-May-1896 to 8-Jul-1896

Member of the Canadian Parliament
